Unique identifier of a row in the table.
Rule:IsValidGuid.

ActivityDate.description:
Date of the transaction. Required field that defaults to the current server date but the user may override it upon insert.
Rule:StringRequired.

ActivityTime.description:
Time of the transaction. Required field that defaults to the current server timebut the user may override it upon insert.

Activity action. It was decided to store the Action itself (instead of the ActnId) in the Transaction table for optimization of the select stored procedures avoiding a join with the ActivityAction table.
Rule:StringRequired.

The time part contains an increment for the number of transactions within the day, starting with 12:00 am and incrementing by one second for each multiple transaction within the day.

PolicyEndEffectiveDate.description: Identifies an endorsement date for a policy. The date part of this field contains the date of the endorsement. The time part contains an increment for the number of transactions withing the day, starting with 12:00 am and incrementing by one second for each multiple transaction within the day. For submissions, which do not require a bpol.PolEffDate, the current date (no time) is used.

PolicyLineOfBusiness.description:
With the possible exception of Monoline, this field stores the translation of what's stored in PolType (prc.Description). If PolType = M, 'Monoline' will be defaulted.

FileName.description:

Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:1,MaxValue:150)

StorageLocationOption.description:
Indicates where this document is stored.
Rule:StringRequired.

StorageSize.description: Once the document has been processed (either in the database or shared location) this is the storage size of the document. If a document is compressed, this is the compressed size. If not compressed, this is the actual size.

HoldersCount.description: To get Holders count within certain date range, please provide 'HoldersCountFromDate' and 'HoldersCountToDate' as query string parameters in valid date format(e.g. HoldersCountFromDate=datetime'01/01/2015').

IsHidePageData.description: Flag to indicate whether Page Data to be included in response or not.

PolicyId.description:
Unique identifier for a row in the BasicPolInfo table.
Rule:IsValidGuid.

AgencyNotationId.description: Foreign key to the setup table AgencyNotation. This table stores agency defined notation values (flags) for customers, policies or submissions.

BillAccountingNumber.description:
Company account number for the customer.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:20)

BillMethod.description:
The method of billing used. Required for a policy,always null for a submission.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:1)

BrokerCode.description:
The Broker for the policy. For a policy, it will be plugged from the Broker row marked active in the AdditionalPersonnel table. For a submission, it will be entered via the interface. This is a required field if the customer is a broker's customer.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:3)

CompanyCode.description:
Parent company or Brokerage company for which the policy is written with. Foreign key maintained in the Company table as a unique identifier of a company. The CoType column determines what value is stored. If CoType = N then this is a normal company code, if type = B then this is a Brokerage company code. Field is always null for subscription and submission policies.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:3)

CompanyCustomerNumber.description:
Company customer number used for import/export.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:30)

CompanyType.description:
Flag to determine what type of Company the policy is written for. If set to subscription or submission, then the CoCode column will be null, otherwise the CoCode column will contain a company or brokerage code.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:1)

CompanyUrl.description: The location or URL of a website for the company.

CsrCode.description:
The Account Rep for the policy. For a policy it will be plugged from the CSR row marked active in the AdditionalPersonnel table. For a submission, it will be entered via the interface.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:3)

EffectiveDate.description: The date the policy becomes effective. The user may change this to any date as long as there are no endorsements on the policy and the policy has not been posted (once posted you cannot change this date). If there are endorsements, the date may be changed to any date less than the first endorsement date. This is enforced through the dialog. The column is required for a policy, may be null for a submission. With the exception of a submission, this date will always equal the EffDate of the first PolT record for this policy. Must be less than PolExpDate.

ExecCode.description:
The Account Exec for the policy. For a policy it will be plugged from the Exec row marked active in the AdditionalPersonnel table. For a submission, it will be entered via the interface.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:3)

ExpiryDate.description: The date the policy expires.  The column cannot be null for a policy record. If the column IsContinuous is checked then SQL_HIGHDATE will be stored. Because most of the fields in dialogs will expect the expiration date to be blank if a continuous policy, the stored procedures will return NULL in this field if IsContinuous = 'Y'. The column may be null for a submission. Must be less than PolEffDate.

FlatAmount.description:
Used for negotiated commissions. The amount of commission if the negotiated commission is a flat amount.
Rule:Range. (MinValue:"0",MaxValue:"99999999999.99")

GLDepartmentCode.description:
The agency's department the policy is assigned to. Cannot be changed once the policy has been posted. Required for a policy, always null for a submission.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:3)

GLDivisionCode.description:
The agency's division the policy is assigned to. Cannot bechanged once the policy has been posted. Required for a policy, always null for a submission.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:3)

IsContinuous.description: Flag to determine if policy does not expire. If the policy is continuous, then the policy expiration date (PolExpDate) will equal SQL_HIGHDATE.

IsExclDelete.description: This field will flag a policy so that it cannot be deleted.

IsFinanced.description: Flag to indicate if the policy is financed. This is an informational field only that's entered on the dialog and plugged by download. It is not referenced and does not plug anywhere.

IsMultiEntity.description: Flag to determine if this policy is sold to a multi-entity customer. If YES, then the customer premium breakdown for this policy/LOB/transaction will be stored in the PolicyMultiEntity table.

IsNewBusinessPolicy.description: Indicates if business is new to the agency.

IsWritingCompanyLogoAvailable.description: Flag to determine if the writing company logo is available or not.

MasterAgencyCode.description:
The master agency code assigned from the company.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:10)

MultiEntityARFlag.description:
Flag to determine for this Multi-entity policy if the Master customer or the Sub-customer is responsible for the billing.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:1)

NationalProducerCode.description: A numeric code that is being issued for all producers from the national Insurance Producer Registry to eliminate the sole dependency on using social security numbers as unique identifiers.

NegotiatedCommissionsValidDate.description: Agency negotiated commissions are valid for the policy through this date.

ParentCompany.description: Parent Company of the existing company.

Percentage.description:
Used for negotiated commissions. The percentage of agency commission if the negotiated commission is based on the agency commission.
Rule:Range. (MinValue:"0",MaxValue:"100")

PolicyNumber.description:
A company assigned number used to identify a policy. If the agency does not have a number for a policy/application, they will assign a temporary number.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:25)

PolicySubType.description:
Flag that indicates if the row is for a policy, submission or an accounting policy (generated when processing a direct bill statement).
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:1)

PolicyTypeLOB.description:
With the possible exception of Monoline, this field stores the translation of what's stored in PolType (prc.Description). If PolType = M, 'Monoline' will be defaulted. However, it will be overwritten by the prcode.description translation of the first non null lob.LineOfBus column attached to this policy (lob.ExpDate must = SQL_HIGHDATE but can be any lob.EffDate). This column is maintained entirely within SQL (spu_bpol and lob triggers).
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:150)

PriorPolicy.description:
For a POLICY, stores the prior policy number (plugged on renewal). The user can add to and/or key over the information. Column is used in the renewal report. For a SUBMISSION, stores the user entered data for the 're-market of' field on the dialog. The dialog controlled length for Prior Policy is 40 char, Re-market of allows 80 char.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:80)

PriorPolicyId.description: Stores the policy id of the prior term policy on renewed or rewritten policies. This value will only be set when a policy is renewed or rewritten using the application or during download.

RenewalReportFlag.description:
Determines if the policy should be included on the Renewal Report. If flag set to Canceled or non-renewed, the policy will be included on the Lost Business Report.

SourcePolicyId.description: Stores the ID from the policy that this BPOL row was created from (via renewal, copy policy, or new policy from submission). Will be null if a submission or a new policy (not from submission).

PolicyEffectiveDate.description: The date the policy becomes effective. The user may change this to any date as long as there are no endorsements on the policy and the policy has not been posted (once posted you cannot change this date). If there are endorsements, the date may be changed to any date less than the first endorsement date. This is enforced through the dialog. The column is required for a policy, may be null for a submission. With the exception of a submission, this date will always equal the EffDate of the first PolT record for this policy. Must be less than PolExpDate.

PolicyExpiredDate.description: The date the policy expires.  The column cannot be null for a policy record. If the column IsContinuous is checked then SQL_HIGHDATE will be stored. Because most of the fields in dialogs will expect the expiration date to be blank if a continuous policy, the stored procedures will return NULL in this field if IsContinuous = 'Y'. The column may be null for a submission. Must be less than PolEffDate.

If there are endorsements, the date may be changed to any date less than the first endorsement date. This is enforced through the dialog. The column is required for a policy, may be null for a submission. With the exception of a submission, this date will always equal the EffDate of the first PolT record for this policy. Must be less than PolExpDate.

PolicyExpirationDate.description: The date the policy expires.  The column cannot be null for a policy record. If the column IsContinuous is checked then SQL_HIGHDATE will be stored. Because most of the fields in dialogs will expect the expiration date to be blank if a continuous policy, the stored procedures will return NULL in this field if IsContinuous = 'Y'. The column may be null for a submission. Must be less than PolEffDate.

PolicyId.description: Unique identifier for a row in the BasicPolInfo table.

AgencyNotationId.description: Foreign key to the setup table AgencyNotation.  This table stores agency defined notation values (flags) for  customers, policies or submissions.

BillMethod.description: The method of billing used.  Required for a policy,always null for a submission.

BrokerCode.description: The Broker for the policy.  For a policy, it will be plugged from the Broker row marked active in the AdditionalPersonnel table.  For a submission, it will be entered via the interface.  This is a required field if the customer is a broker's customer.

CompanyCode.description: Parent company or Brokerage company for which the policy is written with.  Foreign key maintained in the Company table as a unique identifier of a company. The CoType column determines what value is stored.  If CoType = N then this is a normal company code, if type = B then this is a Brokerage company code.  Field is always null for subscription and submission policies.

CompanyCustomerNumber.description: Company customer number used for import/export.

CompanyType.description: Flag to determine what type of Company the policy is written for.  If set to subscription or submission, then the CoCode column will be null, otherwise the CoCode column will contain a company or brokerage code.

CompanyUrl.description: The location or URL of a website for the company.

CsrCode.description: The Account Rep for the policy.  For a policy it will be plugged from the CSR row marked active in the AdditionalPersonnel table.  For a submission, it will be entered via the interface.

EffectiveDate.description: The date the policy becomes effective.  The user may change this to any date as long as there are no endorsements on the policy and the policy has not been posted (once posted you cannot change this date).  If there are endorsements, the date may be changed to any date less than the first endorsement date. This is enforced through the dialog.  The column is required for a policy, may be null for a submission.  With the exception of a submission, this date will always equal the EffDate of the first PolT record for this policy.  Must be less than PolExpDate.

ExecCode.description: The Account Exec for the policy.  For a policy it will be plugged from the Exec row marked active in the AdditionalPersonnel table.  For a submission, it will be entered via the interface.

ExpiryDate.description: The date the policy expires.   The column cannot be null for a policy record.  If the column IsContinuous is checked then SQL_HIGHDATE will be stored.  Because most of the fields in dialogs will expect the expiration date to be blank if a continuous policy, the stored procedures will return NULL in this field if IsContinuous = 'Y'.  The column may be null for a submission.  Must be less than PolEffDate.

GLDepartmentCode.description: The agency's department the policy is assigned to. Cannot be changed once the policy has been posted. Required for a policy, always null for a submission.

GLDivisionCode.description: The agency's division the policy is assigned to.  Cannot bechanged once the policy has been posted.  Required for a policy, always null for a submission.

IsContinuous.description: Flag to determine if policy does not expire.  If the policy is continuous, then the policy expiration date (PolExpDate) will equal SQL_HIGHDATE.

IsExclDelete.description: This field will flag a policy so that it cannot be deleted.

IsFinanced.description: Flag to indicate if the policy is financed.  This is an informational field only that's entered on the dialog and plugged by download.  It is not referenced and does not plug anywhere.

IsMultiEntity.description: Flag to determine if this policy is sold to a multi-entity customer.  If YES, then the customer premium breakdown for this policy/LOB/transaction will be stored in the PolicyMultiEntity table.

IsNewBusinessPolicy.description: Indicates if business is new to the agency.

NationalProducersCode.description: A numeric code that is being issued for all producers from the national Insurance Producer Registry to eliminate the sole dependency on using social security numbers as unique identifiers.

ParentCompany.description: Parent Company of the existing company.

PolicyNumber.description: A company assigned number used to identify a policy.  If the agency does not have a number for a policy/application, they will assign a temporary number.

PolicySubType.description: Flag that indicates if the row is for a policy, submission or an accounting policy (generated when processing a direct bill statement).

PolicyType.description: Type of Policy (i.e. Auto Policy, Workers Comp, Pkg, etc)

PolicyTypeLOB.description: With the possible exception of Monoline, this field stores the translation of what's stored in PolType (prc.Description). If PolType = M, 'Monoline' will be defaulted.  However, it will be overwritten by the prcode.description translation of the first non null lob.LineOfBus column attached to this policy (lob.ExpDate must = SQL_HIGHDATE but can be any lob.EffDate).  This column is maintained entirely within SQL (spu_bpol and lob triggers).

PriorPolicy.description: For a POLICY, stores the prior policy number (plugged on renewal).  The user can add to and/or key over the information. Column is used in the renewal report.  For a SUBMISSION, stores the user entered data for the 're-market of' field on the dialog.  The dialog controlled length for Prior Policy is 40 char, Re-market of allows 80 char.

PriorPolicyId.description: Stores the polid of the prior term policy on renewed or rewritten policies.  This value will only be set when a policy is renewed or rewritten using the application or during download.

RenewalReportFlag.description: Determines if the policy should be included on the Renewal Report.  If flag set to Canceled or non-renewed, the policy will be included on the Lost Business Report.

SourcePolicyId.description: Stores the ID from the policy that this BPOL row was created from (via renewal, copy policy, or new policy from submission).  Will be null if a submission or a new policy (not from submission).

Underwriter.description: The company's underwriter for the policy.

WritingCompanyCode.description: This field is initially defaulted to the CoCode (parent company).  The user can accept the default or specify a Writing company for the company or brokerage specified in CoCode. This field is required on a policy unless it's a subscription or a submission policy in which case it will always be null.

EffectiveDate.description: This field identifies an endorsement date for a policy and this line of business record. When used in combination with the PolId and LobId it uniquely identifies a LineOfBusiness record. The EffDate combined with PolId are foreign keys maintained in the Policytransaction table used to identify a policy transaction. The date part of this field contains the date of the endorsement. The time part contains an increment for the number of transactions within the day, starting with 12:00 am and incrementing by one second for each multiple transaction within the day.

LineOfBusinessId.description:
This field identifies a line of business/application for a policy. Used in conjunction with the PolId to uniquely identify a Line of business in the LineOfBusiness table.
Rule:IsValidGuid.

ApplicationCreatedDate.description: This field determines when the application was first created. It will always be the same date as the effective date of the transaction on which the app was created. If the date is not equal to the Effective date, you will not be able to view/open the app on dates earlier than the AppCreatedDate.

The user entered description for this LOB transaction
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:30)

ExpirationDate.description: This field identifies when this LOB/application expires. It is set to SQL_HIGHDATE until the row is deleted. When deleted the date is set to the EffDate of the PolT transaction that was used to delete the app.

LineOfBusiness.description: The Line of Business for which the particular application is for. A list of valid values are in the PrCode table.

WritingCompanyCode.description:
Writing Company or brokerage company for this line of business application. Foreign key maintained in the Company table as a unique identifier of a company or brokerage or a writing company under them. Must be the same company as on BPOL (CoCode) or a writing company (child) of that company as defined in company setup. If the policy is a subscription or submission policy, then this field will be null.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:3)

The column may be null for a submission.  Must be > PolEffDate.

PolicyEffectiveDate.description: The date the policy becomes effective.  The user may change this to any date as long as there are no endorsements on the policy and the policy has not been posted (once posted you cannot change this date).  If there are endorsements, the date may be changed to any date less than the first endorsement date. This is enforced through the dialog.  The column is required for a policy, may be null for a submission.  With the exception of a submission, this date will always equal the EffDate of the first PolT record for this policy.  Must be less than PolExpDate.

PolicyExpireDate.description: The date the policy expires.   The column cannot be null for a policy record.  If the column IsContinuous is checked then SQL_HIGHDATE will be stored.  Because most of the fields in dialogs will expect the expiration date to be blank if a continuous policy, the stored procedures will return NULL in this field if IsContinuous = 'Y'.  The column may be null for a submission.  Must be > PolEffDate.

BilledPremium.description: The premium for this LOB transaction that has been billed. If IsExclBilling = 'N' then this amount should equal the sum of the billed premiums stored in the PolicyCompanyPremium table. This field is display only and maintained by the interface.

FullTermPremium.description: This field is primarily used by download although the user can enter/edit the field. The value stored represents what this line of business would cost if the policy were to renew today (taking into account all changes up to and including this transaction change). Since the amount entered takes into account all previous changes, then if you were to total the amounts from only the most current LOB/plan/company poltp rows for this policy, you would have the current value of the policy (future revenue)

IsCorrected.description: Determines if this record is a correction record. If a PolTP row is posted and then a company change is required, the old PolTP row is saved as a Correction record (for billing reference) and a new PolTP line is created and all the children moved to the new line (PolCo PolCP). If IsCorrected = Y, the line will display only when viewing this transaction in open transaction mode (not in view policy mode). This field should never be set to 'Y' for subscription policies since company corrections/changes are made in the subscription dialog PolCo level and not at the tran premium level.

IsPosted.description: Determines if this record has any billing transactions attached to it that have been posted.  It is possible that the premium and billed premium could be 0.00 and this flag = 'Y' since a user could enter premium, bill (post) it, zero out the premium, and bill (post) it. Once this flag is set to 'Y', the LineOfBus, PlanType, WritingCoCode, IsExclBilling and IsMemo fields cannot be changed.  An equivalent check in billing would be to look for the existence of any InvTP rows for this PolTPId where JournalId = not null (=posted).

IsSuspended.description: Determines if this record has any billing transactions attached to it that have not yet been posted. Once this flag is set to 'Y', if the LineOfBus, PlanType, WritingCoCode, IsExclBilling, IsMemo or Premium fields are changed, the user will be warned that the saved billing transactions will be deleted. An equivalent check in billing would be to look for the existence of any InvTP rows for this PolTPId where JournalId = null (=suspended).

Premium.description: User entered premium for this LOB transaction. If IsExclBilling = 'N' then this premium amount should equal the sum of the premiums stored in the PolicyCompanyPremium table. This is verified before the policy is taken to billing and enforced by the interface.

WritingCompanyCode.description:
Writing Company or brokerage company for this line of business premium. Foreign key maintained in the Company table as a unique identifier of a company or brokerage or a writing company under them. Must be the same company as on BPOL (CoCode) or a writing company (child) of that company as defined in company setup. If the policy is a subscription policy, then this field will be null. Once this row is posted, changes to the writing company must be made via the Change Companies button/dialog.
Rule:StringLength. (MinValue:0,MaxValue:3)

EffectiveDate.description: This field identifies an endorsement date for a policy and this line of business record. The date part of this field contains the date of the endorsement.
